name: Duplicate
description: An existing issue was already created

name: Fixed
description: A PR has been merged for this issue

name: Question
description: An issue which isn't directly actionable in code

name: Working as Intended
description: The behavior described is the intended behavior; this is not a bug

name: Bug
description: A bug in TypeScript

name: Needs More Info
description: The issue still hasn't been fully clarified

name: Domain: lib.d.ts
description: The issue relates to the different libraries shipped with TypeScript

name: Design Limitation
description: Constraints of the existing architecture prevent this from being fixed

name: External
description: Relates to another program, environment, or user action which we cannot control.

name: VS Code Tracked
description: There is a VS Code equivalent to this issue

name: Awaiting More Feedback
description: This means we'd like to hear from more people who would be helped by this feature

name: By Design
description: Deprecated - use "Working as Intended" or "Design Limitation" instead

name: Help Wanted
description: You can do this

name: Fix Available
description: A PR has been opened for this issue

name: In Discussion
description: Not yet reached consensus

name: Out of Scope
description: This idea sits outside of the TypeScript language design constraints

name: API
description: Relates to the public API for TypeScript

name: Declined
description: The issue was declined as something which matches the TypeScript vision

name: Domain: Transforms
description: Relates to the public transform API

name: Docs
description: The issue relates to how you learn TypeScript

name: Experience Enhancement
description: Noncontroversial enhancements

name: Needs Proposal
description: This issue needs a plan that clarifies the finer details of how it could be implemented.

name: Infrastructure
description: Issue relates to TypeScript team infrastructure

name: Website Logo
description: Deprecated

name: Too Complex
description: An issue which adding support for may be too complex for the value it adds

name: Needs Investigation
description: This issue needs a team member to investigate its status.

name: Source: Telemetry
description: The issue relates to the telemetry in editors

name: Domain: Quick Fixes
description: Editor-provided fixes, often called code actions.

name: Design Notes
description: Notes from our design meetings

name: Domain: Error Messages
description: The issue relates to error messaging

name: Spec
description: Issues related to the TypeScript language specification

name: Committed
description: The team has roadmapped this issue

name: Domain: JavaScript
description: The issue relates to JavaScript specifically

name: Good First Issue
description: Well scoped, documented and has the green light

name: Breaking Change
description: Would introduce errors in existing code

name: Domain: JSDoc
description: Relates to JSDoc parsing and type generation

name: Domain: Refactorings
description: e.g. extract to constant or function, rename symbol

name: High Priority
description: null

name: Unactionable
description: There isn't something we can do with this issue

name: Visual Studio
description: Integration with Visual Studio

name: Rescheduled
description: This issue was previously scheduled to an earlier milestone

name: Won't Fix
description: The severity and priority of this issue do not warrant the time or complexity needed to fix it

name: Domain: Formatter
description: The issue relates to the built-in formatter

name: Domain: Completion Lists
description: The issue relates to showing completion lists in an editor

name: Crash
description: For flagging bugs which are compiler or service crashes or unclean exits, rather than bad output

name: Domain: Declaration Emit
description: The issue relates to the emission of d.ts files

name: ES6
description: Relates to the ES6 Spec

name: For Backlog Bug
description: PRs that fix a backlog bug

name: Discussion
description: Issues which may not have code impact

name: Suggestion
description: An idea for TypeScript

name: Domain: JSX/TSX
description: Relates to the JSX parser and emitter

name: Effort: Moderate
description: Requires experience with the TypeScript codebase, but feasible. Harder than "Effort: Casual".

name: @types
description: Relates to working with .d.ts files (declaration/definition files) from DefinitelyTyped

name: Revisit
description: An issue worth coming back to

name: For Milestone Bug
description: PRs that fix a bug with a specific milestone

name: Domain: Quick Info
description: e.g. hover text, tool-tips, and tooltips.

name: Domain: Performance
description: Reports of unusually slow behavior

name: Domain: Literal Types
description: Unit types including string literal types, numeric literal types, Boolean literals, null, undefined

name: Website
description: Deprecated - please forward issue to microsoft/TypeScript-Website

name: Domain: TSServer
description: Issues related to the TSServer

name: checkJs
description: Relates to checking JavaScript using TypeScript

name: Domain: Symbol Navigation
description: Relates to go-to-definition, find-all-references, highlighting/occurrences.

name: ES Next
description: New featurers for ECMAScript (a.k.a. ESNext)

name: Domain: Decorators
description: The issue relates to the decorator syntax

name: Canonical
description: This issue contains a lengthy and complete description of a particular problem, solution, or design

name: Domain: Conditional Types
description: The issue relates to conditional types

name: Update Docs on Next Release
description: Indicates that this PR affects docs

name: VS Code Priority
description: Critical issues that VS Code needs fixed in the current TypeScript milestone

name: Domain: Control Flow
description: The issue relates to control flow analysis

name: Domain: Comment Emit
description: The issue relates to the emission of comments when compiling

name: Housekeeping
description: Housekeeping PRs

name: i18n
description: (Ping PDostalek) Translation/Localization/Internationalization of messages in the compiler.

name: Experiment
description: A fork with an experimental idea which might not make it into master

name: Add a Flag
description: Any problem can be solved by flags, except for the problem of having too many flags

name: Domain: ES Modules
description: The issue relates to import/export style module behavior

name: lib update
description: PR modifies files in the `lib` folder

name: Domain: Organize Imports
description: Issues with the organize imports feature

name: Domain: Outlining
description: Relates to multi-line regions that editors can collapse

name: invalid
description: Bad-faith PRs, Hacktoberfest spam

name: PursuitFellowship
description: Help wanted from Pursuit fellowship; others please avoid until Dec 19

name: Domain: Signature Help
description: Information in editor tooltips when invoking a function call

name: Domain: Mapped Types
description: The issue relates to mapped types

name: Domain: Type Inference
description: Related to type inference performed during signature resolution or `infer` type resolution

name: For Uncommitted Bug
description: PR for untriaged, rejected, closed or missing bug

name: Domain: Contextual Types
description: The issue relates to contextual types

name: Scenario: Monorepos & Cross-Project References
description: Relates to composite projects (a.k.a references between "medium sized projects")

name: Effort: Difficult
description: Good luck.

name: Meta-Issue
description: An issue about the team, or the direction of TypeScript

name: Waiting for TC39
description: Unactionable until TC39 reaches some conclusion

name: Domain: Related Error Spans
description: Specifying regions for error messages/diagnostics on multiple locations.

name: Experimentation Needed
description: Someone needs to try this out to see what happens

name: Domain: JS Emit
description: The issue relates to the emission of JavaScript

name: Domain: Indexed Access Types
description: The issue relates to accessing subtypes via index access

name: Planning
description: Iteration plans and roadmapping

name: Domain: --incremental
description: The issue relates to incremental compilation

name: feature-request
description: A request for a new feature

name: Has Repro
description: This issue has compiler-backed repros: https://aka.ms/ts-repros

name: Community Tooling
description: This might be better handled by tooling from the community instead of built into TypeScript

name: Domain: Type Display
description: Bugs relating to showing types in Quick Info/Tooltips, Signature Help, or Completion Info

name: Effort: Casual
description: Good issue if you're already used to contributing to the codebase. Harder than "good first issue".

name: Domain: This-Typing
description: The issue relates to providing types to this

name: ES7
description: Relates to the ES7 Spec

name: ES2017
description: Relates to the ES2017 Spec

name: Domain: tsc -b
description: Issues related to build mode

name: ES2018
description: Relates to the ES2018 Spec

name: Domain: Variance Relationships
description: The issue relates to variance relationships between types

name: Domain: Smart Indentation
description: Automatic indenting after a newline (not quite formatter/formatting)

name: Investigating
description: Is in active investigation

name: Fixed in TSJS repo
description: Fix merged in https://github.com/Microsoft/TSJS-lib-generator, but not ported yet

name: Domain: Index Types
description: Issues with `keyof`
